title: Use uploaded photo on the Yes success screen

requirements.text: Add the user-uploaded image (Snapchat-1579100041.jpg) to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and use it as the image displayed on the success screen (the view shown after clicking “Yes”) instead of the current /assets/generated/heart-couple-portrait.dim_1024x1024.png.

quotes: use this image for the image after yes

acceptanceCriteria: A copy of the uploaded file Snapchat-1579100041.jpg is present under frontend/public/assets/generated with a stable filename (including .dim_WxH in the filename).
When the user clicks “Yes”, the success screen renders the uploaded image (via a /assets/generated/... path) instead of /assets/generated/heart-couple-portrait.dim_1024x1024.png.
The image is loaded directly by the frontend (no backend fetch) and displays correctly in preview/production.
The success screen keeps existing messages and animations unchanged; only the image source/alt text is updated as needed (alt text in English).

constraints: Do not route images through the backend; serve them as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated.
Do not change any immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep all existing success-screen text exactly as currently implemented; only replace the displayed image asset.
nonGoals: Changing the Yes/No interaction logic, success messaging rules, or No-button escalation behavior.
Adding any backend logic or persistence.

required: Monochrome photo of two people holding hands (after-yes-photo.dim_736x1472.jpg)
